intro: Centaurium chloodes, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Centaurium chloodes is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
